More info about the Stock Market Game and all state winners is on our website at

span.strong: The School Board approved tentative dates for graduation as follows:
We are currently working on something to honor our graduates in May; however, we will have a ceremony as soon as the Governor allows gatherings. Thank you for your patience with this.

p.strong: Below is some great information from PBS. This will help with AMI as well as providing support if needed.

Midland prom will be postponed. The Wedding Barn is working with us to reschedule when things return to normal. Juniors, continue selling your tickets for the half and half raffle. We will draw a winner when we return to school.

hr.p: We want to thank you all for your patience and understanding during this time as we work to meet the needs of our students. Over the next three weeks, the work we send home to our students will focus on areas we need to improve upon as a district, Reading and Math. All 7th through 12th grade students have chromebooks they may use if they have internet connection. If you have an elementary student 2nd grade and up that could use a chromebook and you have internet, please contact the elementary school at 501-345-2413. If you do not have internet, AMI packets will be available in the lobby of your child’s school. Please let us know if you are unable to pick up the packets. All AMI material will be collected when the students are able to return to school. Please do not bring them to school before that time. If you have questions or need assistance with the AMI work, please contact your child’s school at the following numbers, Elementary – 501-345-2413 or High School 501-345-2610, during the hours of 9 am to 3 pm Monday through Friday.

We also want to remind you that we are providing a breakfast and lunch to all students up to the age of 18 that live in our district. Please let us know if we can help and you would like to participate in this.

span.strong: Below is some information regarding the COVID-19 virus and how our school is working to minimize its impact.

hr.p: We will release more inforamtion as it comes to us. We appreciate your cooperation with this.

span.strong: Special Education Department is selling t-shirts to help support our Special Olympics athletes in spring competition.
Please use the link below to order. Order forms are being sent home 3/2/20. Thank you for your support!

strong.span: Please use the link below to complete the pre-registration form for Kindergarten enrollment.

div.style: background-color:#ecdddd !important; border: 3px solid #d9534f !important;
color:#d9534f !important;
div.p: ...From the National Weather Service in Little Rock...the Flood Warning continues for the following river in Arkansas... Black River At Black Rock affecting Independence...Jackson and Lawrence Counties River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS. The Flood Warning continues for The Black River At Black Rock. * until Sunday evening...Or until the warning is cancelled. * At 7:00 PM Thursday the stage was 13.8 feet. * Minor flooding is forecast. * Flood stage is 14.0 feet. * Forecast...Rise above flood stage by early Friday morning and continue to rise to near 14.2 feet by Friday early afternoon. The river will fall below flood stage by Saturday evening. * Impacts at 14.0 feet...Minor flooding begins. Farm ground along east bank begins to flood. Fld Observed Forecast 6 AM Crest Location Stg Stg Day Time Fri Sat Sun Crest Time Date Black River Black Rock 14 13.8 Thu 07 PM 14.1 14.1 13.8 14.2 01 PM 04/24 &&

li.a: Mustang of the Month Nomination form

div.p: Midland School District served fifty-four (54) students last year. Seventeen (17) of those students held a 504 or IEP for dyslexia.

The programs used to serve the serves are of appropriate range, depending on the age and needs of the student. Our district utilizes Phonics First Foundations, Phonics First Structures, and Connections.
